greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Lexicographically earliest positive sequence such that a(i) = a(j) => A278219(i) = A278219(j) and A324386(i) = A324386(j), for all i, j >= 0.
comment: Restricted growth sequence transform of the ordered pair [A278219(n), A324386(n)].
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..65537
Index entries for sequences related to binary expansion of n
Index entries for sequences related to primorial base
program: rgs_transform(invec) = { my(om = Map(), outvec = vector(length(invec)), u=1); for(i=1, length(invec), if(mapisdefined(om,invec[i]), my(pp = mapget(om, invec[i])); outvec[i] = outvec[pp] , mapput(om,invec[i],i); outvec[i] = u; u++ )); outvec; };
A046523(n) = { my(f=vecsort(factor(n)[, 2], , 4), p); prod(i=1, #f, (p=nextprime(p+1))^f[i]); }; \\ From A046523
Aux324390(n) = [A278219(n), A324386(n)]; \\ See code for A324386 in that entry.
xref: Cf. also A286619, A324343, A324344, A324380 (compare the scatter-plots).
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Feb 27 2019
